intro: Jacobaea mollis, commonly known as the softleaf groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant features soft, hairy leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and wastelands. Jacobaea mollis is a perennial herb that can reach heights of up to 60 centimeters.
